keyMoments.title: Drim Appears on the Going Merry
keyMoments.description: Drim appears on the deck of the Going Merry at night, carrying Noko's horn, revealing himself as the mysterious boy responsible for the crew's memory loss.
keyMoments.significance: First direct appearance of the arc's antagonist, setting up the central conflict.

keyMoments.title: Confrontation with Luffy
keyMoments.description: Drim is confronted by Luffy who demands answers about their stolen memories. Drim attempts to use Noko's horn defensively.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Drim as a reluctant antagonist who uses Noko's powers.

keyMoments.title: Drim Escapes
keyMoments.description: After the horn is damaged and Luffy begins recovering memories, Drim flees from the Going Merry.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Drim's fear and sets up continued pursuit.

relationships.description: Drim is hypnotized and controlled by Noko the seahorse, unwittingly acting as the instrument for memory theft.

evolutionMoments.description: Drim appears carrying Noko and using the horn's powers, though later episodes reveal he's being controlled.

reveals.information: Drim is the mysterious boy who played the horn that caused the crew's memory loss
Drim has droopy eyes, lavender hair, wears a yellow hat with teal stripes, dark purple cape, and carries a seahorse-shaped horn

keyMoments.title: Noko Appears with Drim
keyMoments.description: Noko, the seahorse-shaped horn carried by Drim, is revealed as the source of the memory-stealing power.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of the true antagonist of the Ocean's Dream Arc.

keyMoments.title: Memory Restoration Effect
keyMoments.description: Noko's horn emits blue sparkling dust that flows into Luffy's mouth while he's awake, partially restoring his memories instead of stealing them.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the dual nature of Noko's power and provides hope for memory restoration.

abilities.description: Noko can steal memories from sleeping people by emitting a mournful sound from his horn that produces blue sparkling dust.
When the horn's dust is absorbed by someone who is awake, it can restore stolen memories instead of stealing them.
Noko can hypnotize targets by looking into their eyes, forcing them to follow his orders.

relationships.description: Noko has hypnotized Drim and uses him as a vessel to move around and gather memories.

evolutionMoments.description: Noko is shown being carried by Drim and using his powers through the boy.

reveals.information: Noko can steal memories through a horn that emits blue dust when played while targets are sleeping
Noko's power works in reverse when the target is awake, restoring memories instead of stealing them
Noko has a bright orange body with red stars and round blue eyes

keyMoments.title: Robin's Deduction About Memory Loss
keyMoments.description: Robin uses her analytical skills to deduce that only those who were sleeping lost their memories, providing the first major clue to solving the mystery.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Robin's crucial role as the crew's intellectual strategist and her ability to remain calm under pressure.
keyMoments.quote: Only those who were sleeping lost their memories. I was awake reading, which is why I still remember everything.

reveals.information: Robin was awake reading late at night, which saved her from the memory loss
Robin demonstrates strong deductive reasoning and analytical skills in solving the memory mystery

keyMoments.title: Flashback to Promise with Kuina
keyMoments.description: Zoro experiences a flashback to his childhood promise with Kuina that one of them would become the world's greatest swordsman.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that even through amnesia, Zoro's core memories and motivations remain deeply embedded in his psyche.
keyMoments.quote: One of us will become the world's greatest swordsman!

keyMoments.title: Flashback to Arlong Park Trauma
keyMoments.description: Nami experiences painful flashback memories of her time under Arlong's control, including forced tattooing and suffering at Arlong Park.
keyMoments.significance: Shows how deeply traumatic experiences remain ingrained even through magical amnesia, highlighting the psychological impact of her past.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Confronts Drim
keyMoments.description: Luffy immediately attacks Drim upon discovering him on the ship, demanding answers about their stolen memories with his characteristic direct approach.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that even without full memories, Luffy's protective instincts toward his crew remain intact.

keyMoments.title: Partial Memory Restoration
keyMoments.description: Luffy's memories are partially restored when Noko's blue dust flows into his mouth while he's awake and fighting.
keyMoments.significance: Provides the first concrete hope that the crew's memories can be recovered and establishes the method for doing so.

keyMoments.title: Flashback Appearance
keyMoments.description: Kuina appears in Zoro's flashback memory about their promise to each other that one of them would become the world's greatest swordsman.
keyMoments.significance: Reinforces the importance of Kuina's influence on Zoro's life and ambitions.
